metadata.name: JAMF MDM Potential Suspicious Child Process
metadata.comment: Detects potential suspicious child processes of "jamf". Could be a sign of potential abuse of Jamf as a C2 server as seen by Typhon MythicAgent.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('/jamf')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/sh'))))

output.summary: Detects potential suspicious child processes of "jamf". Could be a sign of potential abuse of Jamf as a C2 server as seen by Typhon MythicAgent.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate execution of custom scripts or commands by Jamf administrators. Apply additional filters accordingly References: https://github.com/MythicAgents/typhon/, https://www.zoocoup.org/casper/jamf_cheatsheet.pdf, https://docs.jamf.com/10.30.0/jamf-pro/administrator-guide/Components_Installed_on_Managed_Computers.html
